Reviews.Title: “Convenience But No Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: LaneBangkok
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on 10 April enroute to the USA via Changi. The rooms are clean and efficient though many have no windows whatsoever (I think that only the Transit Hotel's double rooms have windows). The front desk staff is not particularly welcoming but they are efficient. What I did find objectionable and hence my low rating is that there is neither a WiFi nor a LAN connection for the Internet in any of their rooms. This boggles my imagination as Singapore is certainly one of the most wired places on the planet. Changi Airport does have free WiFi (though in 12 hour increments) but it doesn't penetrate the rooms of the Transit Hotel. I only discovered the no Wi Fi after checking in (and, as you must pre-pay, you're cooked). Possessed still of a New Yorker's temperament, I objected strongly to this in an airport hotel in Singapore and they acknowledged it is their #1 complaint. Their excuse -- and I think a weak one --- was that the corridors of Terminal 3's Transit Hotel are so angular that a router wouldn't distribute the signal well. Given the cost of multiple routers I see this as a feeble cop-out so if you need to Skype or email late at night, don't stay in this hotel. To be fair, you can hump your notebook or iPad to the lobby (check-in area) of the hotel and get a weak signal from Changi Airport itself. Given the money the Transit Hotel charges, this oversight is deliberate and causes me to give them a mighty low rating.

Reviews.Title: “Can work out quite expensive.”
Reviews.Author: StevePerrott
Reviews.Content: The Transit Hotels at Changi Airport Singapore are excellent places to overnight between flights. You rarely hear aircraft even though you can look from your window and see them departing/landing next to you. The rooms are very clean and facilities excellent. The one downside is that you are sold a 6hr block to start then commence hourly rates for the rest of your stay. This can be quite ex'ie if you are not looking at going into the actual city.

Reviews.Title: “Part of a good plan”
Reviews.Author: CaptGreeny
Reviews.Content: We have used this facility a number of times. The rooms are more than adequate and well equipped. This is after all a transit stop. Rooms are generally clean and maintained to a high standard. Be prepared to book early. My only complaint would be that unless you plan ahead you stand a good chance of missing out on a room, this is becoming increasingly popular, so perhaps a larger facility could be built. Overall, well worth the few dollars it costs , if you need to break a journey up. Nothing like a showr and sleep to get you off on the right foot again.

Reviews.Title: “Great idea, well executed. Book early!”
Reviews.Author: Bokhara
Reviews.Content: This is such a boon to those with a long lay-over in Singapore. Used it twice recently and what a difference it makes to be able to have a shower & hop into a proper bed for 6-8 hours in the midst of a couple of long leg flights. Another shower and change of clothes had me refreshed and looking forward to the next flight. The rooms are basic, but quite adequate for the time you're there. If you can't get into the Hotel, the Lounge directly opposite has showers, computer facilities and a snoozing area, for about S$35.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times. The staff are efficient and the rooms are comfortable but very basic. A few small improvements would help: real soap (not a dribble of soap in a plastic satchel) and a hand towel would be a very welcome addition. For a standard six hour block the price is probably not too bad, but we had the room this time for 10 hours and paid just over SGD$150 which hardly felt like value for money. Yes, I will stay here again - but only because there is very little choice that close the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, considering lack of options”
Reviews.Author: ExLibris76
Reviews.Content: The hotel recommends you book weeks beforehand to guarantee a room. This is sound advice since even as I checked in people were dozing around the lounge area waiting for rooms to become free. Potential customers were turned away and I overheard a receptionist say T2 was also full. And this was a quiet late Saturday evening. My single room had two beds and a small desk with tea/coffee making facilities. The room itself was clean and modern, but otherwise unremarkable. Previous reviewers mentioned hard beds; but I found it firmly comfortable and had no trouble sleeping whatsoever. Neither was a lack of windows a problem for me. The rooms are extremely well insulated: you cannot hear a thing from outside, even the A/C unit was imperceptible. The wall-mounted TV reception was clear, but limited to only about six channels or so. Still, the idea is to get much needed sleep, not to ponder the decor or watch TV - and on that score this hotel hits the mark perfectly. The bathroom only has a shower stall - no bath - but it was scrupulously clean and the water pressure was strong enough to wake the senses. Toiletries are limited - liquid soap at the washbasin and shower is via a wall-mounted dispenser - but no toothpaste! However, there is a chemist nearby to purchase your own toiletries, if you wish. I found their rates quite reasonable considering the lack of alternatives airside. There is another hotel 'outside', but you have to clear C & I and then collect your baggage. Too much bother for most, I think. If sleep is important to you - before or after a long haul flight - then I recommend this hotel - its clean, very quiet and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Take a break on the long UK - Australia flight”
Reviews.Author: LindenSD
Reviews.Content: An airside hotel is a wonderful thing for a break on that long haul between UK and Australia or New Zealand. It's clean, it has all the basics, the service is efficient, and there's no mucking around going through customs. Makes that flight much more endurable.

Reviews.Title: “Very claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideGuy70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 14 hours during transit, the prospect seemed good, being able to lie flat on a comfortable bed was welcome news after a 18h non-stop flight from EWR. The rooms are very comfortable, and they are very quiet and have all the amenities you'd expect in a hotel room, BUT...the room we were given did not have any windows or any ventilation, other than the aircon. It was very claustrophobic! My girlfriend also suffers from claustrophobia and even though we were really tired, it was very unnerving to sleep there. Also the toilet has a sensor flushing system, and maybe the one in our room was busted, because it kept flushing every half hour and this disturbed our sleep very much. There is nothing wrong with the hotel itself, except the fact that there are no windows/ventilation system and absolutely no natural light in the rooms. The only advantage is that because it is inside the terminal, you don't have to clear immigration.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay J
Reviews.Content: This is a very handy and good way to get a good sleep while in transit in Singapore. Get straight off the flight and go to your room – easy. Rooms are good quality and clean, but don’t have a lot of extra space in them (but what do you need it for, when you won’t be there long and can explore the airport 24hrs anyway). A note on baggage – on one of our stays we changed airlines in Singapore and couldn’t check our bags straight through, so we had to follow the recommended procedure letting our baggage be collected from the conveyor and having them taken to lost and found. This worked just as the told us, so the next morning when we woke, we cleared immigration, went to lost and found (of the terminal we arrived the prior night) and picked up our bags. Then cleared customs and re-check in for our next flight. Nothing to worry about, as the bags are stored and while on the conveyor the area is still before people have cleared customs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Dealing with Long Stopovers.”
Reviews.Author: Fitz1948
Reviews.Content: We regularly travel to see our family in New Zealand and prefer to fly Singapore Airlines from Manchester. The outward flight arrives in Singapore around 7am and the next leg departs late in the same evening. All we want to do is sleep! The rooms are decent three star en suite with no windows - important because we are sleeping through the day. Coupled with our membership of Priority Pass (giving access to lounges) the Ambassador is an excellent and econmical way of making long haul cattle class travel bearable -Just!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stop over”
Reviews.Author: Renee B
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 hours in this clean welcome space during a stop over in Singapore. The shower was clean and the beds felt upon or 2 am arrival. We were arriving from China and had a early morning flight back to the US. I think this was a good easy way to give yourself and easy transition. We did not have to clear immigration just go straight from the arriving flight to the hotel and next morning go to the transit desk. They moved our luggage from the arrival holding area to our departing gate and we headed to the Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great showers, expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: RLT-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Having a sleep in transit is great…and having a shower pours gallons of water a second on you is superb. BUT - two things to watch for: 1. When you book online they will change your booking to a different terminal without warning…check your email confirmation! 2. The free SIN airport WiFi doesn't extend to the hotel rooms. You have to pay about US$10 an hour for wired Internet, and there is no cable in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep is worth paying anything for and this hotel is fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: crankyannie
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time staying at this hotel. If you travel to Australia / New Zealand via Changi airport, then I urge you to stay here. Travelling non stop is pure torture especially with small children. The rooms are spacious and the most recent room we stayed in had an adjoining door. We had small children with us so the room we had was huge with a little alcove to put our bags, sit down and blow dry our hair etc. The room already had a king bed and single bed and a baby cot were all ready for us we arrived at the hotel. We just walked up to the Mezzanine and booked in (it's located near the passport control in the airport so be careful not to leave the main terminal building as it could easily happen particularly if you're sleep deprived). It was a fight to get into the shower but because it was so large it could have easily accommodated a family. The bathroom itself was large. There was a flatscreen TV with various programmes including some kids programmes but to be honest we were all so tired that we just slept as soon as our heads hit the pillows. There were no windows in this room so the room was pitch black which helped the kids get to sleep. We try and book the rooms for about 14-16 hours to allow enough time to eat, get washed, sleep, re-pack our hand luggage for the remainder of our long journey and eat. The reception team have your flight details and can organise a wake up call for you if you need one. After you check out, you can also leave your luggage at reception while you go eat. Rooms are charged on an hourly rate but it is so worth it for what you get. Large room, immaculately clean, dark and quiet. What more could you ask for! Eatery / food hall right outside the entrance to this hotel (mezzanine level) so you don't even have to go far to eat local cuisine or fast food. There is a butterfly atrium which is fantastic for kids and is located to your right as you come out the door of this hotel. Then on the ground floor there are relaxation chairs, huge pool with carp fish, and a small playground. Last but not least for all the plane spotters there are fantastic views of one of the runways.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travellerguy101
Reviews.Content: Excellent for long transit hours, every time I travel through Changi I'm sure to accommodate for 6 hours of solid sleep. This hotel doesn't disappoint, mark deduction for small amount of grime along the shower and pretty sad coffee..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to catch up on some z's”
Reviews.Author: surfboyNorwich
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation with the transit hotel the night before we left London, the hotel does recommend that you book well in advance as it is popular. On arrival the check in staff were able to organise us two rooms after a short wait in the airport whilst they prepared our rooms. The rooms are basic but very clean and have everything you need to catch up on some sleep & freshen up. There is a tv with reasonable selection of channels, tea & coffee making facilities. I would definitely be using this hotel again next time we transit through Singapore as it is excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “very comertable”
Reviews.Author: rickypasir
Reviews.Content: rooms are nice and equipped with basic requirements. very decent place to relax and carry on with your journey. I will surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Break!!!”
Reviews.Author: CBSCOR
Reviews.Content: In between long flights, this a wonderful break. We used to stay at the Crown Plaza, which is attached to Terminal 3, which required clearing immigration, security and all that. This hotel (3 locations) is inside the terminal and within the transit area. No need to go through immigration/security etc. Rooms are very small and basic. But this gives you a chance to lay down horizontally for a few hours. Rates are charged on a minimum of 6 hours block, after that in 1 hour increments. Few rooms with windows looking down on the tarmac. Most of the rooms have no windows at all........Overall - Serves the purpose of providing a break from the journey.........

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: SimonSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on as we had a 12 hour layover before our next flight to London. We checked in at 12:30 AM very quick, you need passport and onward ticket ? The rooms are inside the terminal with no external windows. However they have used mirrors and and curtains to give the idea it is a conventional hotel with windows. Bed was very good. Having travelled through 6 other beds during our trip managed to get 5 hours kip. Had a good shower at in the morning with all but tooth paste and brush provided. Good place for rest.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Bubiana
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here on our trip from Sydney to London in June 2009. I have to say breaking up the journey was the best idea! This hotel was fantastic! We touched down 1/2 hour early (10pm ish) and had a booking at the hotel for 12am, we thought that we would have to wait around the airport for 2 hours. Fortunately there was a room ready for us and we just paid the extra hour. The rooms were tidy and exceptionally clean, and very modern. The fact that it had no windows was not claustrophobic as they made it look like it did with a curtain! (we had to actually look behind it to confirm that it was a brick wall!). The bed was super comfortable and we had a fantastic sleep. We had a few hours to explore the airport which i highly recommend as there are so many things to do in there! We have booked again for our trip over in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShepKincumber
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is Clean and Tidy in an International Airport

Reviews.Title: “I wish every airport had one of these!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimroger17767
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 6 hours ( paid S$76.51 ) on a stopover. All I can say is it made a a huge difference in suffering 18 hours cooped up in cattle class! room was spacious. Comfortable bed, bathroom equipped with everything you would need. We had no window so if you are claustrophobic might be an issue! Had no issues with being woken up by other guests in the vicinity, our departure gate was about 5 minutes from the hotel! Only downfall was the small selection of tv channels. I

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest between long flights”
Reviews.Author: 8pairs
Reviews.Content: We purposely planned a long layover in order to take advantage of the transit hotel. Our 8 year old finds it incredibly difficult to sleep on long haul flights (excitement and difficulty getting comfortable) and this worked very well for us. We had been up early, 6am, to commence our trip from Melb to Singapore and arrived about 3pm Singapore time. We had paid for 7 hours at the hotel, in a family room (1 double, 1 single) and it cost about AUD$90. It was just as I had expected, perhaps a bit more spacious. It was very quiet, the airconditioning worked well and the bathroom was large with a double shower.My son was able to get about 4 hours sleep and us, a couple of hours but we didn't do it for us. It was nice to be able to stretch out and have a shower after spending quite a bit of time in the very humid butterfly house at the airport. We were travelling with a friend who chose to head straight into Singapore to catch up with friends. He was able to leave his small cabin bag with us and then have a shower when he returned at 11pm, to get ready for our 1am onward flight. There is a fair bit to see and do at Changi airport so it was a great balance of "sightseeing" and resting for those 11 hours. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome oasis after a very long day of travel”
Reviews.Author: ArchiBoi
Reviews.Content: After almost 18 hours of traveling, I arrived at Changi Terminal 3 at 2:00 AM Dec. 18. By the time I collect my luggage, clear immigration, and grab a taxi to Singapore City, it would have been close to 3:30 AM so I just opted to stay at the transit hotel instead and collect my luggage later that morning at a more decent hour. There are two Ambassador transit hotels, one in Terminal 2 and the more newly refurbished one in Terminal 3. Since I arrived at Term. 3, I made reservations in the Term. 3 transit hotel which is located at the far end of the terminal airside (Do not clear immigration). The rooms can be booked at an initial 6 hour block of time and hourly thereafter. I had booked a 6 hour block and an additional hour. The first 6 hour block was approx. $68SG, for a single room and an additional $15SG per hour thereafter. My room was a single interior room which had no windows, though I believe that there are rooms that do have windows and overlook the tarmac. At that time in the morning, I was only interested in getting some sleep. Check-in was smooth and efficient. It was not crowded at that time in the morning so I was in my room after 10 minutes. The room was large for a single with a double bed, coffee making facilities, and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was equally large and stocked with basic amenities of soap, bath gel/shampoo. Both the room and the bathroom was very clean, and more importantly was quiet. I was afraid that I would hear the roar of jet engines. If arriving at Changi at a late hour, I would definitely recommend staying at the transit hotel until the morning. If you are arriving at Terminal 2, it is possible to go the the Terminal 3 transit hotel as both terminals are connected. It would just be a long walk. I highly recommend booking ahead of time through their website. Booking was easy and I got a confirmation after 24 hours. There is no WI-FI in the rooms but there is wi-fi throughout Changi airport. It's free, you just need to register at the information booth and a password will be given.

Reviews.Title: “Great transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: ben_steph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way to Sydney during an 11 hour stop over. The hotel simply exceeded our expectations and was on par with some 4 star hotels you could find in any major city. The room and bathroom were huge and very clean. Reception staff was very friendly and polite. This is an option to consider while on a long stop over given the price (about £35 for a six hour stay). This also makes your trip a lot more bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: SydneyChin_Chin
Reviews.Content: Clean, tidy and noise free for a perfect siesta in transit - not sure on price though as had to check out earlier due to kids waking up but no refund offered and not mentioned on check in either. Staff effecient and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Is it Worth it?”
Reviews.Author: MajorBlow
Reviews.Content: I had a long stopover arriving early evening and departing noon next day. I was in two minds whether to book a room at the Ambassador T3, or 'camp out' on one of the terminal's lounge chairs. At SG$15 per hour I thought the hotel expensive, but against this weighed up the cost of lost belongings if they were to be stolen whilst I slept in the open terminal. I didn't want the hastle of clearing immigration and staying in town; then having to clear security to re-enter the terminal. So I decided to take a room for 10 hours. I was irritated by the booking in procedure that required residential details same as if I were booking in to a hotel outside the terminal... especially when required to pay up front instead of checkout. But the process only took a few minutes and I was given the key (a proper key not a key card) to my room. The corridors to the rooms were a bit of a warren - lots of signs telling you which way to the lobby but not so many directing you to your room. The room itself was windowless, but clean albeit basic. Ample space, nice shower, and firm yet comfortable double bed. Only half a dozen chanels on the wall mounted flat screen TV for anyone who might wish to spend their time viewing instead of sleeping. Tea and coffee making facilities provided. If you needed a razor, comb, toothbrush etc you had to ask the reception and these were provided free. Soap, shampoo, and shower cap only provided as standard in the room. A few metres from the lobby on the same level (adjacent to Burger King) was a convenience shop so if you needed any toiletries or deodorants etc they were available reasonably priced. No wifi/internet in the rooms either - the reception said it wasn't working in the rooms although once in the room there was a flyer to tell you that internet was available at charge. Elsewhere in the terminal the wifi is free. Seems a shame that could not be extended to the rooms for free also. Was it worth it? Yes. I would not have enjoyed quality sleep without, or the opportunity to freshen up under a nice shower in the morning. I would recommend booking in advance (without obligation) as they suggest - seemed to me there were quite a few guests checking in on the spur of the moment so better to book to be sure of a room. If in similar circumstances with a long stopover I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and easy”
Reviews.Author: walkfree
Reviews.Content: First of all, Terminal 3 in the Singapore Airport is amazing with its large assortment of shopping, dining, free movies, butterfly garden, swimming pool and a hotel. The Transit hotel is clean, efficient but nothing fancy. It's great if you have a short layover, need a rest and shower, or a very early morning flight. The hotel is in the secure area of the airport so you don't have to claim your luggage between flights. Your luggage is transferred to your next flight for you. All you need is an overnight bag. The room isn't that cheap - they charge by 6 hour blocks - but the convenience makes up for that. Each six hour block was about $60 US and $15 US for each additional hour up to six. The rooms are clean but basic. One caution: We thought we would go into Singapore for dinner and a few hours of touring but because United/Continental hadn't issued our boarding passes yet and they only work between 3:30 AM and 1 PM, we weren't able to get our boarding passes until the next morning. Without boarding passes, you can't get back to the secure area of the airport, hence couldn't get back to the Transit hotel. So we were stuck in the airport. At least it was one of the best airports to get stuck spending a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep, lovely sleep!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kersan
Reviews.Content: I flew from Frankfurt to Singapore with Singapore Airlines....a flight of about 12 hours and only dozed for about an hour. Thus, when I arrived in the airport I was a real jet lagged cot case, desparate for some sleep. I arrived at the Ambassador Transit Hotel in Terminal 3 at about 6-45 am and had to wait until 8-00am to get a room. I booked it for 8 hours. The room was large, dark and very, very quiet and I was asleep in a comfortable bed within about 10 minutes. The next thing I knew was the telephone ringing at 3-30 in the afternoon.... had to vacate the room at 4-00pm. Time for a quick shower in the beautiful bathroom and then a lovely cup of tea I made myself provided in the room and I left feeling wonderful and completely refreshed. I did not take off for Australia until 11-50pm and it was a 7 hour flight to Adelaide. I still arrived fresh, not tired and NOT JET LAGGED as I was when I did a similar trip in 2005. I found this hotel just wonderful and it was the best AU$86 that I spent on my entire 7 week trip to Europe. If you are on a similar flight and you do not stop in this Hotel, then you deserve to be Jetlagged!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Practical Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jessica097
Reviews.Content: My flight from Melbourne landed at 11.30pm, the connecting flight is 2pm the next day. Normally I'd do everything possible to avoid having stay in an airport overnight. But I heard there are many things to do in Changi, and the transit hotel is quite good, so I booked a room in T3. The room itself is basic, but clean and practical. I slept well and feel ready to explore Changi the next morning. Note that to stay here you can't collect your checked luggage, pack accordingly. Also, it's very popular so you need to book well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Long haul stopover”
Reviews.Author: Molenders
Reviews.Content: Ideal onsite break for those on long haul flights through Singapore. A basic clean and modern ensuite bedroom facility, no frills, apart from free access to an outdoor swimming pool on the roof of terminal 1. A chance to catch up on sleep and refresh for next flight. Charges start with a basic block of 6 hours to which can be added 1 hour plus extensions to meet requirement. No need to pass through immigration, no visas and if time allows take advantage of free conducted tour of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient When Wanting To Break Up Your Journey.”
Reviews.Author: my_time2010
Reviews.Content: I always stay here to break up a long journey so that I arrive at my final destination refreshed. The room is clean, comfortable & cheap. Min. booking is 6 hours then you can extend by the hour(s) The hotel is located at the airport at terminal 3 making duty free shopping very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Skakagrall
Reviews.Content: Very convenient airport hotel that you can check into immediately off your plane. It's actually in the terminal so you can go there without passing through customs or immigration.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to catch 40 winks”
Reviews.Author: Rocketfrogs
Reviews.Content: Most people arrive rather shattered after a long haul into Singapore. If you're in transit this is the perfect place to rest up for your next leg. There are restaurants, movie theatre (free) and bars just outside the door and the rooms are a cool oasis.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: bineundstef
Reviews.Content: we had a 6hours stay at this airport hotel and were very glad we booked it so we could have a shower and sleep a littlbe bit before we flew further. the room was clean and was bigger than we expected, had no window, but it was night anyway so we didn't care, bathroom clean with a nice shower. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: BonnieMax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an 18 hour stop over from Zurich to Adelaide and thought this would be a great way to rest. We stayed in room 342, it was clean, modern, quite and dark. We had a great catch up sleep and a couple of showers. This made the next flight allot easier and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Sagar S
Reviews.Content: This transit hotel in T3 (terminal 3) definitely needs to be booked well ahead. The tariff is SG$75 for six hours and SG$ 15 for every hour thereafter. The mostly windowless rooms are small and with an attached bathroom. The cleanliness is just about adequate. There is a wall mounted TV with limited channels and also a coffee maker. Reception is smart and check in is quick and they offer to wake you up for your connecting flight. There is a food court near by and also a 24 hour movie theatre which is free. They offer you hair, nail, foot therapy and massage services (see photograph for details). This hotel is not the one where one goes for an experience but for convenience. ‘Adequate’ is how I would describe this place.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and just what is needed”
Reviews.Author: diverdoc
Reviews.Content: I've used the transit hotel in Changi lots of times, usually in terminal 2 but also in terminal 1. It's just what is needed when you need to get a bit of rest between flights. Efficient and fast check-in, pleasant staff, and comfortable beds. Basic, but when you just want to sleep off your jetlag before the next leg it's just what is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to refresh”
Reviews.Author: ba340
Reviews.Content: Leaving the plane to getting into the room took 15 minutes. The rooms are spotless and After sitting on a plane for 18 hours, what a great place to have a shower and a sound sleep- There is a hot water kettle and tea/coffee sachets, soap/shampoo dispenser in the shower and there is a hairdryer. What a great place to break a long journey and the only minor negative is the very firm bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great peaceful place for a rest between flights”
Reviews.Author: thePB
Reviews.Content: I had 16 hours between flights at Changhi and booked into the Transit Hotel for 12 hours - minimum stay 6 hours, cost was GBP 70 for my 12 hours - I had a a large spacious twin room , spacious en-suite (shower only) - the room was so peacefully quiet and dark enabling me to have a great 8 hour sleep before my next onward flight. I pre-booked and the check-in process was seamless, with calm welcoming staff - no delay in accessing room. Very much "fit for purpose".

Reviews.Title: “Why aren't more airports like this?”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLooch
Reviews.Content: We checked in night before lunchtime flight the following day - as we felt that it would be more relaxing, what with the normal stress that goes with travelling with families. It worked perfectly. Check-in was smooth. The rooms were well designed, perfectly functional, very quiet, dark and comfortable. There is the option of the swimming pool for free in Terminal 1. The rooms in Terminal 3 are better than Terminal 1 from memory (though that was 5yrs ago). There is a very well positioned convenience store and butterfly garden next to the hotel, as well as a massive selection of food outlets. A lot cheaper than the hotel outside!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Good quiet spacious rooms Tea anc coffee facilities and onsite for restoative shower and snooze

Reviews.Title: “Always look forward to the rest”
Reviews.Author: Anthony1962
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel several times during the last 12 months & highly recommend it. Room is small but who cares, it's the bed & shower that matters. Check-in & check-out is quick. I normally take the 6 hours plus 1 or 2 extra which gives plenty of time for a good sleep & refreshing shower. There is a television & electric jug in the room (with tea & coffee sachets provided). The bed is comfortable, although additional pillows would be good. Adjust the room temperature to your liking as often its way too cold. The rooms are very insulated from the runway (although a slight vibration can be felt when a plane takes off) but noisy travelers in adjoining rooms can be a problem. Remember this is a transit hotel, don't compare it to a full service or city hotel. It serves its purpose very well

Reviews.Title: “First time in a transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marysvillian
Reviews.Content: Having flown to London several times, arriving jet-lagged and wasting valuable holiday time to recover, it was time to think of a new strategy: the transit hotel. I'd read on this site and heard from other people that this hotel had tiny, windowless rooms etc but we found that the room was more than adequate for a refreshing night's sleep. The rooms were of a size commensurate with 3 star standards although the bathroom was probably a little bigger. There were drawn curtains along one wall which gave the illusion of there being a window, which helped with the overall impression of the spotlessly kept, smart interior. For the convenience of walking off the plane with hand luggage and 15 minutes later being installed in an hotel room, then in the morning (after 8 hours quality sleep and a luxurious shower), walking 15 minutes to the departure gate, I would have gladly put up with a hotel of lesser standard. But, luckily, no need to suffer... this was brilliant! (There was the added bonus of making the hotel an easy meeting point for my traveling companion flying from a different Australian city.) We booked the room online once our plane ticket had been issued. It seems this is absolutely essential to guarantee a room because, as others have mentioned, weary travelers without reservations, missed out. For the quality of the room and the convenience, I thought the price was very reasonable. We booked the room for 9 hours and it cost just under $AU100 for 2. Quoting from the hotel website: "Rates quoted are based on a minimum charge of 1 block of 6 hours. Rates are subjected to changes without prior notice. - Twin Occupancy - S$76.51 Nett - Extension per hour - S$15.30 Nett" Next year I'm meeting 3 other people from all over Australia for a night's sleep at this hotel, en route to Paris because as a strategy to minimize jet-lag, this worked perfectly: we were off the plane in London and ready to enjoy our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: kangarooboy
Reviews.Content: We fly from Sydney to Paris & we need to break up the journey. So we had a 30 hour stopover in Singapore. Rather than spend time collecting luggage go through customs get a taxi into town,check-in to a hotel, sleep overnight then catch a taxi back to airport, we tried the Amb. Transit Hotel. So glad we did. We simply walked off the plane with hand luggage straight into a quiet modern room & modern bathroom. Clean & Air-Con. Our luggage was sent on with our next flight. We stayed 24 hours slept showered, watched a movie, ate at the airport restaurants & were completely refreshed.Worth every bit of $250 & better than paying an extra $9,000 per couple for Business Class.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it says on the box”
Reviews.Author: MrHulotetlesKiwi
Reviews.Content: It's a Terminal Transit Hotel and a good one too. We stayed there for 6 hours on our journey from London to Christchurch, New Zealand. The room was comfortable with a large bathroom. The only negative thing was that next door tried to open the connecting door and woke us up! Next time we will make sure that we get a room without connecting doors. I would recommend Wi Fi in the rooms. Book a room during transit, it will make your trip more bearable.

Reviews.Title: “The best accommodation inside an airport!”
Reviews.Author: GMVince
Reviews.Content: The service is always excellent at the Transit Hotel in Terminal 3, and on each time that I have been there to stay while I was in Transit at Changi International Airport, I've always chosen to stay there, because of the excellent service, comfortable rooms, the truly fine location of that Transit Hotel in Terminal 3 inside the Changi International Airport. There is everything just a short walking distance from that Transit Hotel, because there are food outlets, free internet stations, free foot massaging machines, free cinema, the convenience store, a bar, duty free shopping, and a smoking area all very close to that Transit Hotel, so if you are just staying in Singapore over night, then do not look further than the Transit Hotel at Terminal 3 inside the Changi International Airport Singapore. They also have 'budget' rooms with a common shower block for everyone to use, so it is even cheaper to stay there for tired travellers. I know you will be impressed with the Transit Hotel inside Changi Airport in Terminal 3.

Reviews.Title: “(Only) Terminal 3 is modern and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ATW06
Reviews.Content: No matter, which terminal you are leaving from, Terminal 3 Ambassador Transit Hotel seems a good option to get some rest (travel between the terminals is very qucik and easy). It is quiet, clean and comfortable. It was very popular at the time I was there, so reservation is neccessary. Rooms are modern, but simple, there is a modern TV, a clean bathroom and a desk, but no other extras. Not even windows. Positive: there is was building noise (other than in the other terminals) at the time (June 2010). And with the 6 hour booking frames it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We had a 14hr stopoverin singapore.”
Reviews.Author: sheree099
Reviews.Content: so we booked a room for 12 hours. money well invested for relaxation and sleep. excellent idea to stay in the airport and got the feet up and eyes shut...

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a lie down between flights”
Reviews.Author: nomadsnomore
Reviews.Content: We had a 6 hour stop over in Singapore on our way to the UK from New Zealand. We booked a room so we could lie down and stretch our legs out as it was going to be a long journey. I am glad we only had 4 hours booked! I could not have stayed all night in this room. The floor shook and the bed with the constant coming and going of aircraft, could have been the A380 coming and going as they are huge. Bed was ok but not mega comfortable, shower was adequate but felt they could provide more products for showering and hair washing and stuff as you are so limited as to what you can take onboard the aircraft in hand luggage. There was a child running up and down the corridor screaming for what seemed like ages which was very annoying when we had such a short time to get some sleep. If I go that way again I think I would prefer to have a 1 or 2 day stopover and get a room outside of the airport terminal.

Reviews.Title: “High quality basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: broughhouse
Reviews.Content: Other reviews more or less spot on: by basic I mean no frilly service, but a large room, double and single beds, spacious and disbled-friendly en-suite facilities, including a wet-room for a shower. Plenty of hot water. Quiet. Comfortable bed. No windows in my room, but that's not what you use this facility for. Pricy for extended stays (68 Sing dollars for six hours), but for my 9 hour layover it meant I got over five horizontal hours - priceless on a trip from Australia to UK. Check-in efficient, automated wake-up call with manual reminder ten minutes later.

Reviews.Title: “One of the great innovations in travel”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelCamel
Reviews.Content: Transit hotels, there should be more of them. Being able to stay within an airport is sometimes far preferable to passing through immigration and baggage checks, and then having to repeat that effort the next day on check-in. The hotel in terminal three is a simple affair, but it is more than adequate for a short or overnight stay. There is no room service, no fancy toiletries but you have a clean and incredibly convenient location - it was only a three minute walk to my gate the next morning. Sometimes it is possible to hear the departure of planes, so it may cause problems if you are a light sleeper. My room had a window that overlooked the tarmac, and was able to see an Airbus A380 parked directly outside of my room - splendid! The hotel informed me that they can accept bookings as soon as you have a confirmed airline reservation. I would suggest doing this as during my check-out a young family arrived wishing to stay but were turned away due to being fully booked. The forlorn look on their faces said it all as they now needed to find a spot within the terminal to rest instead. A suggestion to anyone flying with Singapore Airlines or Silk Air is to make use of their check-in services 48 hours prior to a flight. Arriving the night before an early-mid morning flight allows you to check-in, grab a meal in one of the restaurants, and then head to the hotel. Waking up the next morning at a respectable hour, it is an easy journey to the gate. This is preferable to shortening your sleep in order to travel to the airport to go through the usual departure procedures. I also stayed at the Crowne Plaze Changi Airport a couple of weeks earlier and can make the following comparison. If price is everything, then stay at the Transit Hotel, if comfort is your primary goal, head to the Crowne. However, due to the Crowne being so expensive, unless you have a layover of more than twelve hours, it is hard to justify the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: 2skidivers
Reviews.Content: With a long layover in Singapore, this transit hotel is very convenient. As they start charging in 6 hour blocks, we first went downstairs (outside passport control), to the food court and shopping in the basement level of the T3 terminal. All manner of food can be found here from Popeye's to a wide range of local foods that were excellent and cheap! We then checked into our room which was clean, well-maintained and very cold! We tried turning up the thermostat to a less bone-chilling temp, but that didn't seem to work, so we just turned off the fan. The room eventually warmed up a bit. The wake up call was as ordered. There was plenty of hot water in the shower. The room coffee and tea service was also a nice convenience. For any long layover in Changi, where there isn't enough time to get into the city, this is a best bet for a comfortable, quiet place to rest. Also, as previous reviewers have noted, make sure you have your reservation in place before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect travel situation”
Reviews.Author: cspacenz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a number of times at the Transit Hotels at Singapore Changi and think they are fantastic. I love Singapore as a stopover and the airport terminals are perfect for this. Often I will stay a few days and get a suitable hotel in the city but on this occasion I had an awkwardly timed 18 hour stopover so booked a room in the Transit Hotel for 7 hours. They take a minimum booking of 6 hours then charge for every hour after that and I find the rates quite exceptional and way more economical than taking a room in a nearby hotel. So I sleep for 5 or 6 hours then Singapore being as user friendly as it is it's easy to get on a bus, train or taxi into the city for even a few hours to get some terrific food and shopping or just a bit of a look around after showering and cleaning up in the room. They have budget rooms with shared facilities or normal hotel type rooms, I am quite happy with either. Everything is clean and neat, service is excellent and it's just all very easy. A couple of things, make sure you book well ahead if possible, I find if I am unable to get a booking then I keep re-applying as things change all the time, but certainly don't take booking for granted as they really are quite popular. Also be aware that there are major renovations going on at Terminal 3 so can be quite noisy (you can get that anywhere in the world at times) they will give you earplugs, but in my experience if you need the sleep you will sleep regardless. Fantastic option and is so typical of the Singapore super-efficiency that we come to love, Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels which is minutes away from the boarding gates”
Reviews.Author: wirpool
Reviews.Content: I have about 10 hours because of long flight connection from SIN to SYD. I did not book this hotel in advance and contacted reception on arrival at 8AM. The first available room was at 9 PM. They charge for 6 hours pax about 75 USD. The room is small without any windows. It is EXTRIMLY cold inside - about 15-18C. I guess in Asia they believe that it is cooler it is more better-) I was frozen for this 6 hours and was sleeping in my clothers. Unfortunately, there was not possible to turn off air conditioning. As a result I get sick upon arrival to Australia. This hotel could be good possibility to have a shower and have a rest in between your flights in Singapore at the airport but you should make sure that in your room the temperature is comfortable for you. Should you have more time and able to pay more I would strongly recommend Crown Plaza airport hotel, which is just on the left after passports control. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Pay by the hour - What do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: Okanagantraveller99
Reviews.Content: After 21 hours of trans-Pacific travel before a morning flight to Langkawi any clean bed will do, and that is what is offered here. Nothing fancy, no real ammenities, and the price is reasonable. Two hints: reserve ahead - we saw one couple arrive at 1 am like we did only to be told the next available room was 9am, and don't leave the securiry zone within the terminal to get your luggage for the ongoing flight - you can't get back into the hotel without a boarding pass for that flight. Oh yeah, a third hint - the hotel will give you toothbrush, comb etc. but if you don't want to sleep in your underwear pack something in your carry on.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest when in Transit”
Reviews.Author: Texas06
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in transit at this hotel. The hotel rents out in blocks of 6 hours. it is on the 3rd level of Terminal 3 across from transfer counter B. Take the skytrain to Terminal 3 before you clear immigration and customs. The check in process was quick and simple. The rooms are small, basic with no window and a small bathroom. It was clean and good enough for a few hours rest. If you are going to be out you may want to check in after you return. We made the mistake by paying for 6 hours which we spent in town! We checked in, freshened up and since we did not need a visa to see Singapore we spent a few hours site seeing. There is a free 1/2 day tour into Singapore but the last one leaves at 3pm so we missed that. You can take Bus # 36 from the airport basement after you clear customs. The bus needs exact change so get it before you exit. It is rather slow (too many stops) but we enjoyed seeing the city. If you get off at Raffles Ave you are right by the newly opened Helix bridge and museum (a must see) and the Marina Bay mall. From there it is a long walk to Clark Quay and a short walk to Glutton bay for good, cheap food. You can also take the MRT green line, get off at Tanah Merah and take the red/purple line to city hall or Raffles place. Then a long walk to Clark Quay or Raffles ave. If you like chilli/pepper crab, Jumbo seafood is a must but it is pricey and there is a long wait. There are 2 around Clark Quay. The Changi airport is open 24 hours so you can come in late and go through immigration to get back to the hotel. There are lots of food places on the 2nd floor in the transit area as well if you don't want to go into town. Overall a good place for overnight transit passengers like us who do not want to sleep on uncomfortable chairs at the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, perfect for transitting pax”
Reviews.Author: Wilibona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here both during outbound and inbound transit via Singapore. This is a nice hotel in good location. Perfect if you have a 3-9 hours layover in Changi. Just watch out though that the price gets a bit expensive once you stay above 12 hours. It may be better if you just stayed in the city. I stayed in T3 area. Nice room, well maintained and clean. The size is on the smaller side. The bathroom is also decent. It is kind of camouflaged. You can see a curtain but there is no window actually. The staff is very courteous, even when I arrived at 2 in the morning. But just do not expect any service here. It's a transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a long stopover”
Reviews.Author: tasadventure
Reviews.Content: I booked into here as I had a long stopover at Changi Airport. When I made the reservation in my confirmation email they said not to clear immigration/get luggage, leave until the morning. I would not advise this. I took this advice and 1. the next morning I didn't have a change of clothes, toothbrush etc. 2. I had major problems with immigration as my luggage went to lost property and they wanted to charge me for a visa. Take the extra time that night, allow for it, and get your stuff. It will save you stuffing around in the early hours and panicking about missing check in times etc. The hotel was good enough, a bit noisy. Air conditioning didn't work too wel so it was hot and stuffy. I hear they have a pool though?

Reviews.Title: “Well done for everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: rocktardhard
Reviews.Content: We took only 1 night in this hotel because after a long fly, we were all tired and did not want to take any further step. Thanks god, we found it and we found what we need for 1 night staying. Front desk staff was quite helpful and polite. The best part is our room which is very tidy and comfortable. It is a good place to lay down a bit and take a short rest before get into the city. Well done for everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: CharlieA_9
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this or the terminal 2 hotel in transit. The rooms are basic but all you need in transit. The showers are the best. Rooms are very quiet and always clean. Wake up calls are always on time. Close to all airport facilities eg free movies & the departure gates. Great value

Reviews.Title: “The most convenient, cleanest, restful rooms of any airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SFWanderer
Reviews.Content: First of all, you can't beat its location within Terminal 3! Why would anyone settle on sleeping on chairs or in an airport lounge when for about US$100 (double accommodation) for 8 hours you can rest soundly in a bed here?? The staff at the desk are very friendly and best of all, the rooms are modern, comfortable, clean, quiet, convenient and affordable. If you're lucky, there may be one of five window rooms available upon check in. You can make the request for a "runway view" when making your reservation but it's basically on a first come, first serve basis. Check out the picture of the A380 just outside our window! Directly next door is a free cinema featuring full-length movies and the Ambassador Lounge just next to that. At the bottom of the escalator from the hotel is the "B" Transit desk; convenient for those traveling on Singapore and United Airlines, among others.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Bornereda
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed was very clean, good facilities. The breakfast was very good and included, attentive staff. Great service for money. Thanks, stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest your head!”
Reviews.Author: coyotes_uk
Reviews.Content: I have recently spent some time at the Ambassador Transit Hotel Changi Airport Terminal 3, and found it a very very nice hotel to catch up on some sleep! Located upstaris within Terminal 3, and next to the Ambassador Transit lounge and free cinema, the hotel is easy to find! A 6 hour block costs around SGD60, and additional hour blocks are available to extend your stay. The rooms are spacious, air conditioned and the bed is large and very comfortable. The en-suite is clean, again quite big, and has a walk in shower, toilet and sink. The main room has the bed, bedside tables, work top and flat screen TV. I can only speak for the room I had but it had no windows, although as I spent my 6 hours asleep it didnt matter! Wake up call's can be arranged with the front desk, who's staff are extreemly helpful! I turned up on the day and got a room within an hour, but if you want to walk off your plane and into your room, I would recomend booking in advance! All in all, very happy with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravelClaim
Reviews.Content: I was traveling between Perth and Paris (vice versa on the return trip) and had a 10 hour stopover. I had to find a decent hotel to rest due to the long haul flight but wanted a hotel that I can check in at my leisure. This hotel was perfect. You paid for 6 hour lots and if you need more you can pay for single hour increments, check the website for more details. You do not need to go through immigration to check into the hotel, therefore you must send your luggage to the final destination, be aware of this, so make sure you pack any carry-on luggage with any necessities. Book at least a few weeks in advance, they have a lot of rooms, but Singapore have thousands of passengers that come through their gates and hour. Pros: Rooms are nice and spacious, clean, comfortable and peaceful. Not sure about the location of the other hotels in other terminals, but the terminal 3 hotel was close to a cinema, shops and cafes and a butterfly house. Cons: If you want to leave the terminal you have to go through immigration and can only go out once and come back in once. So once you are out, you are out. It doesn't take long to pass through immigration however, so its not a very big deal just a little inconvenient. Overall: I would stay here each time I had a long haul flight, its a nice place to relax, Singapore airport has a lot of comforts.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN QUIET AND WELL APPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: HOTELLMEMORE
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and particularly efficient given the fact that I mistakingly booked my room for the right day but not for the right month... The room #325 was clean, quiet and well appointed with a quality mattress allowing me to shower, relax and sleep during the 6 hour- time frame I paid for. Please do consider that some rooms are interconnecting as was mine. It was not an issue this time but I know how bothersome it can be. Moreover, claustrophobic people won’t appreciate the fact that rooms have no windows. Keep in mind that this is a TRANSIT hotel. Check-out was prompt. Will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My Brief Review Of Changi Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiNiks
Reviews.Content: The last time that I stayed overnight there was back in the end of 2005. Major rennovations have been done since then. Hotel is fantastic and immaculate, with great service! AWESOME high pressure showers, especially after such a long flight! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: sirdaav
Reviews.Content: Singapore Changi is amjor gateway, and the newest terminal also has the nicest amenities. Walk through shops, orchids, koi ponds and visit sunflower and butterfly gardens all before you check in at the transit hotel and sleep. free wifi at Changi - get a code from customer service desk. Free PS3 stations for kids, select areas have free Singapore tours and free Segway rides too (although I heard they would soon start charging a few bucks for this.) You could visit Changi for 2-3 days easy. The T3 Ambassador hotel is the newest and nicest of them all. Flat screen TV, nice bathroom. Very modern decor. All new and like all of Singapore, spotless! Rate is reasonable, easier and cheaper than travelling into city for few hours sleep to fly out again. Just over 40 USD per night. I also stayed in T1 Ambassador hotel it's OK but not as new. T1 is undergoing major renovation. No matter which Transit hotel you are booked in, you can walk between them all without going outside.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Tuck33
Reviews.Content: Had booked a 12 hour block before flying out to Vietnam, so had to fill in a 2 hours at the terminals before we could check in. Not hard to fill time in at this airport though!!. Very prompt check in. Rooms comfortable although basic (had to laugh at the curtain with the bedroom wall directly behind it). My only gripe was that the toilet seemed to have a sensor on it and would flush when you were either on it or sometimes just walking past it and that there was no fridge in the room. Apart from that it , was very convenient not having to go through customs and feeling fresh for our flight the next day. At $160 Singapore the night it is not super cheap but I guess you are paying for the convenience. Plenty of places in food court for breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient - great for long stopovers”
Reviews.Author: DanO68
Reviews.Content: If you ever have a long layover in Singapore, this is the place to stay. You can buy blocks of time from 4hrs up to however long you want to stay. My 8hr stay cost about US$70 - great value in my book. The hotel is in the terminal itself, so you don't have to go through immigration. The hotel is well located in Changi terminal 3, about 50m from the foodcourt and supermarket and right next door to a 24hr movie theater and gym. The location is quiet and peaceful. The room was fairly spacious with a couple of single beds and a TV on the wall. The TV channels were fairly limited, but a couple of them were English speaking. The room was spotlessly clean and well-maintained with a simple lighting system. The bathroom was spacious with a great hot shower. I had a really good sleep. The thing I didn't like about it was there was no outside window, but the way the hotel is designed within the terminal, only a few of the rooms would actually be on the outside wall. Reception staff were competent and efficient, making check-in and check-out really quick and easy. Overall, great value. I recommend this hotel to all transit passengers needing a place to crash for a few hours or overnight. I will most definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal transit hotel..Bravo..”
Reviews.Author: rwintour
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were on the way back to Jakarta fr HKG. We arrived in Spore at 1 o'clock in the morning. As we had our reservation months before (reservation made by phone and so easy to get it confirmed) so no hassle happened, moreover we got a run-way view room which we should have requested on the time of booking since this kind of rooms are limited. The room was just more than enough space for such transit stay and the bathroom was huge for such hotel. Other thing was most important the room and bath were super clean..very Singapore and thats what we needed after exhausting late night flight. The food outlets are some still open (Burger King and chicken hainam resto) 24 hour...the light in Terminal 3 were still bright so we got the mall like ambience and its nice to feel. Since I am an airliner freak, the last that I enjoyed was the view from our room to the runway where I could enjoy seeing the airplanes taking off, landing or just taxiing...great views but no noise of the jet machines leaking into the room. So this transit hotel at Changi T3 is really beyond my expectation...Bravo Changi..

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover between flights”
Reviews.Author: aspira
Reviews.Content: We had a 9 hour break between flights and booked in for a block of 7 hours. Our room was spotless, very comfortable and had all the facilities we needed. There was a TV, tea and coffee making facilities and the staff arranged a wake up call when we arrived. The room rates are very reasonable and I would recommend it to everyone. We will certainly book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: redrose93
Reviews.Content: The Transit Hotels at Singapore's Changi AIrport are fantastic. Perfect for the time spent in-between flights, the rooms are booked in blocks. This is cheap and efficient, and perfect for getting as much sleep as possible in between flights. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. There are no windows, so complete darkness is guaranteed. The beds are very comfortable, and there is a television in the room so if sleep doesn't come, there is still something to pass the time with. The bathroom is very nice and modern, with a large shower and the usual array of soap and hair products. The only thing that I would criticise about this hotel is the glass window facing into the bedroom. The window is covered by wooden blinds, but it is unnerving as the slant of the slats allow you to see into the bedroom from the bathroom. This gives the feeling that people in the bedroom can see back in. They can't, but it's a weird feeling. Overall, the service is quick and efficient, the rooms value for money, and it is a really good idea to give travellers a chance to shower and sleep in between flights.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: MarmaladeT
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we booked via their website and the respons was within 24 hours - excellent. Then we changed our flights and had to amend the check in date and extend the number of hours we needed (16 hours) - both requests were actioned within 24 hours - again excellent. The room was more than large enough for the two of us (my sister and me), with extremely comfortable beds, nice cotton sheets, the towels were fine, the water pressure in the shower was very strong and the shower itself was very large. The room was well soundproofed and we heard nothing outside and so slept like proverbial logs. There was a large flat screen tv on the wall, but we were tired and so didn't really watch any tele. We were on our way to the UK, so it was great to break the journey here - we had a shower before bed and another when we got up and so felt refreshed before our next flight. If travelling in economy class, this is certainly something I can recommend. By the time we arrived at LHR, we didn't feel so bad at all (not like on previous flights where we'd flown virtually straight through). There were plenty of food outlets within a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel and the food was very good too, so thumbs up to Changi :-) If I had another layover at Changi for more than a couple of hours, I'd definitely book a room again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: chai77
Reviews.Content: transitting overnight in singapore, this place is very hard to beat for value for money and shear convinence. I did not think about it but yes - there were no toiletries provided. we too brought tooth brush and shaving stuff from the plane. they did however did provide packets of shampoo and hair conditioner. located just next door to a large upstair food court - excellent choice of singapore food market . those family with family ( mum,dad and 2 kids) may have to have 2 rooms, i heard family rooms are located at T1

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I needed. Incredibly quiet which was perfect. Didn't have to clear immigration, etc. Double and timely wake up calls. Only curious thing is that they had no toothbrush or razor in the bathroom. I grabbed some from the Singapore Airlines Lounge before I check in just in case but had I flown coach instead of business class I would have had to leave the hotel and buy them which would have been a drag so be forewarned that those amenities were not in the room. However perhaps if I asked for them they would have been provided.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the middle of a very long trip”
Reviews.Author: Savvy_Family
Reviews.Content: We arrived after flying nearly 20 hours to find pure silence, a spotlessly clean room and effortless check-in and check-out process. While it was a little disconcerting to know our checked luggage would be spending the night in the lost and found (that we'd have to retrieve it in the morning), we were assured it was perfectly safe and standard practice - and it was. So be sure you have your change of clothes in your carry-on and you are good to go. This place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Travelodge Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: chilleruk
Reviews.Content: We booked in for a 15 hour stopover at the airport. Being the only transit hotel in T3, its a bit of a cornered market. Arrival was a bit frustrating. After a long day we found out at check in that we would need to get our boarding pass for our onward flight before being allowed to check in, why??!!! So we trapsed down to get a boarding pass for our next day flight. Accommodation was ok, clean, comfortable room. A few more amienities wouldnt go amiss since the carrying of liquids is not permitted on flights anymore, even if they were chargable. The towels in the shower room were really to small for purpose. You only had the choice of 6 channels in the room, two were in English, a local news channel and one other, unfortunately it was a charity night on one of the channels so I don't know what they would usually show. Personally I would increase the number of channels to help pass the time away. (BBC World News or the Australia Network for instance). They may want to see if they can have the room channels tuned into the arrival departure boards in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: snapper238
Reviews.Content: We paid AU$65 for our stop over at the Ambassor Hotel and it was well worth it. I caught up on a couple of hours sleep, had a shower, watched some TV and had a cup of coffee or two. Our room was a bit on the small side, but more than adequate. Ultra clean and modern, I could fault the cleanliness or decor. I compared the prices of purchasing items individually at the airport, like a shower and nap room, by the time I added it up for two people it was better value to rent the room. That way we could leave our belongings secure in our room while we walk around the airport. If you are a smoker, you'll have to go down one floor and head behind the esculators (I took a shortcut through the ladies each time, instead of walking the long way around) then turn to your left.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is the main selling point”
Reviews.Author: CoastersOnHols
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've used the transit hotel when travelling via Singapore. If you have a few hours or a night stop over in Singapore, it's ideal as you don't have to clear customs or make your way into the city. The room was pretty bland inside but it had the basics such as TV, tea/coffee making etc. There were a few annoyances though, all in the bathroom. Only one small thin towel each, no face towels, annoying sachets of shampoo and shower gel which with wet hands are difficult to open. Also the hair dryer is the type you have to keep your finger on the button to work. These are the bits I'll remember about the hotel but it won't put us off using it again in the future as convenience is the main selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!!”
Reviews.Author: jcorbygas
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 9 hours between flights and was very impressed. Room very clean and spacious with big tv. Bed was a bit hard though. The shower room was very clean and good shower. However, my favourite part was that on opening the curtains our room was about 5 metres from the flight gates and the runways, and as I am a bit of a plane spotter I was in heaven!! Very reasonable price and I enjoyed my stay there more than the 8 nights at my hotel in Thailand!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the perfect rest between long haul flights”
Reviews.Author: Jcp744
Reviews.Content: What can I say: blackout curtains, cant hear the planes, refeshing shower, comfy bed, tea/coffee in room, located within the terminal for the ultimate convinence, If you have a stop over for around 6 hours, do yourself a favour book it as it beats the airport chairs, you can sleep and wash and generally be in a good mood for the next gruelling long haul flight!

Reviews.Title: “makes economy flights bearable”
Reviews.Author: magsrich
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 5 hour block between longhaul flights LHR to SYD, We had caught the A380 SQ flight to Singapore after a long day of sightseeing, so although the 380 is very good we were so tired and hadnt really slept much on the 12 hour flight, this was so convenient just a few minutes walk from the plane and we were in the queue to checkin, staff were efficient but busy. Slept like a log after a great shower. Wake up call on time, grabbed a cuppa and tv news before 2 minute walk to boarding, feeling human again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stretch out after hours in economy”
Reviews.Author: deejay17
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Ambassador Transit Hotel in Terminal 3 was all positive. After hours in cramped conditions in the plane and with another longer flight ahead it was great to be able to stretch out and relax after enjoying the luxury of a hot shower. The facilities are excellent for the purpose with the normal tea and coffee making facilities, television etc but the main need halfway through a flight is to be able to lie flat and relax with the confidence that if you do go to sleep there is a wake up call. The airport has a lot to offer in terms of entertainment and food before the next leg begins and if you haven't already been 'movied out' on the plane there is a free theatre adjacent to the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Idea, Location, Great sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tadtv
Reviews.Content: This transit hotel was excellent. We were going to try the private sleeper rooms in Singapore Airline's First Class lounge, but read that they were more like lounge chairs not beds. Opted for the T3 Transit hotel for 6 hours instead. It was perfect. We showered before and after sleeping and after almost 5 hours of sleep, we felt like it was a whole new day- not just a long layover overnight. Bed comfortable. Location is so close we almost missed it. It was literally above gate that we just deplaned from. Our room #362 had a wall of glass that you can look right down on the people deplaning- and to outside planes parked at gates. Curtains make it dark. Room looked brand new and clean. Smelt new. Large shower with EASY TO USE controls- NO THINKING-no messing with knobs and levers in the middle of jetlag night. Great water pressure. Several towels. Soap and shampoo are in little packets- enough for several showers. Only gripe is there was only one tiny bar of soap so it was hard to wash myself in shower- shower gel needs a buff puff thingy. TIP- bring one of those buff puffs in your carry on in a plastic bag- also bring toothbrushes. We got ours from the plane. Also need deodorant. Remember, your bags are checked all the way through so you won't see them. -Wake up call had a reminder 15 minutes later- nice touch. -Great price for what you get. NIce flatscreen TV on wall. -Noise level was okay- could hear announcements faintly. Skimpy towels. Excellent choice for the money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Accomdation”
Reviews.Author: Kalpage
Reviews.Content: I found accomdation very handy and easy if you have stay a few hours in Singapore as there is no travel time or cost to get to the hotel . The rooms were clean and ok. The staff were very cold and had no customer service view but did not worry me

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: BartletsAgent
Reviews.Content: We booked online for the Terminal 3 Ambassador Transit Hotel and got a reply with a confirmation letter within 24 hours. The hotel was excellent - we had a 7 hour stopover and just wanted to have a shower etc and it provided everything we needed. The room had 3 single beds which were very comfortable. The walk in shower was modern and large - very good for freshening up - and basic toiletries were provided along with towels. It was also very quiet considering there must have been people coming and going all the time - we never heard anyone else at all. It's next to the Ambassador Transit lounge where you can pre-book massages etc and there is also a free movie theatre just at the entrance. Bookings are for a minimum of 6 hours but if you only have a couple of hours and want a shower the Ambassador Transit Lounge offers showers (towels but no toiletries provided) for S$8.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: yat-Hawaii
Reviews.Content: The transit hotel was newly renovated so the rooms were very clean. The staff was efficent and friendly. We felt staying inside the airport hotel was more convienient/less costly than having to go thru custom and taxi into town for a overnt when our SQ flt out was on the next morning. Shops and restrauants were all open to keep us occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed”
Reviews.Author: yfb
Reviews.Content: This place serves a great niche. Rooms are very clean, beds are comfortable and there is a large wall mounted TV opposite the bed. The room I had didn't have a window which felt a little disconcerting but it wasn't a problem after such a long flight. The door lock was a little tricky to open and be careful of the big lip on the door between the washroom and bed area. I managed to stub my foot on it, I swear it was close to 2 inches high. The reservation system is a bit of a nightmare as it is not automated. You should book well in advance as it typically takes 3 or 4 days to confirm your reservation, be sure to take a printout of your confirmation with you when checking in. Staff at the check-in desk were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mel_S_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our trip, and were very impressed. The beds are very comfortable and have clean bedding, and the rooms and bathrooms are similarly very clean. There are tea and coffee making facilities and large TVs. The bathrooms are large and extremely well-equipped, with huge shower cubicles, towels, soap, shampoo and hairdryers. We requested wake-up calls which were followed up with a call from the front desk. It was ideal for relaxing and sleeping between flights, and we would highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Ambassador Transit Hotel Terminal 3
HotelInfo.Address: Transit Mall North, Mezzanine Level (Level 3) | Across from Transfer Counter B, access via Escalator, Glass Lift to level 3, Singapore, Singapore
